intro: Tridactyle inflata, commonly known as the inflated tridactyl, is a unique flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It is characterized by its distinctive, inflated, three-lobed seed pods that give it its common name. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its leaves are typically palmately lobed, and it produces small, pale yellow flowers. Tridactyle inflata is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
